label: 株仲間
本: The Moneylenders of Late Medieval Kyoto . University of Hawai'i Press . 2001
説明文: In 1692, the shogun's Kyoto deputy directed [pawnbrokers], for easier control from above, to form kabunakama, commercial monopoly groups in which membership took the form of stock shares. In 1699, there wre 628 pawnbrokers in Kyoto organized into such groups paying monthly dues.
